results.title: Jupiter and Mars
results.brief_description: Two dolphins are on a quest to save the planet after catastrophic sea-level rise due to climate change. Guided by a unique ‘echo-location’ game mechanic based on the sonar abilities of dolphins, players navigate sunken landmarks and vast oceans.

constellations_primary.name: The dolphin Constellation
constellations_primary.description: This Constellation echoes representations of dolphins across screen media.

results.description:
Two dolphins are on a quest to save the planet after catastrophic sea-level rise due to climate change. Guided by a unique ‘echo-location’ game mechanic based on the sonar abilities of dolphins, players navigate sunken landmarks and vast oceans rendered in a visual style reminiscent of Disney’s Tron.

Created by former journalists James Mielke and Sam Kennedy, Jupiter and Mars was inspired by Alan Weisman’s book The World Without Us (2007) and imagines a planet where nature has reclaimed the land. While that might require some imagination, the team consulted with environmental scientists to ensure the game world and the rise of sea levels in it was scientifically accurate.
description_for_label:
Two dolphins are on a quest to save the planet after catastrophic sea-level rise due to climate change. Guided by a unique ‘echo-location’ game mechanic based on the sonar abilities of dolphins, players navigate sunken landmarks and vast oceans rendered in a visual style reminiscent of Disney’s Tron.

Created by former journalists James Mielke and Sam Kennedy, Jupiter and Mars was inspired by Alan Weisman’s book The World Without Us (2007) and imagines a planet where nature has reclaimed the land. While that might require some imagination, the team consulted with environmental scientists to ensure the game world and the rise of sea levels in it was scientifically accurate.

results.title: Her Story
results.brief_description: Independently developed by Sam Barlow, Her Story uses live-action footage to follow a police interrogation and is influenced by the directing techniques of Alfred Hitchcock and the Dogme 95 school of filmmaking, as well as real-life interrogations and Sharon Stone’s performance in Basic Instinct (1992).

constellations_primary.name: Screen story searching
constellations_primary.description: Cinema, smartphones and sensuality collide in this intriguing Constellation that takes a distinctly different path.

results.description:
Hannah’s husband is missing and the police have questions.

Her Story follows Hannah’s interrogation and is an interactive full-motion video (FMV) narrative made up of seven police interviews, split into smaller clips viewed on a 1990s-style desktop. Players watch, interpret and dissect these interviews to discover the truth in the characters’ stories.

Independently developed by Sam Barlow, Her Story uses live-action footage instead of rendered character models and is influenced by the directing techniques of Alfred Hitchcock and the Dogme 95 school of filmmaking, as well as real-life interrogations and Sharon Stone’s performance in Basic Instinct (1992).
description_for_label:
Hannah’s husband is missing and the police have questions.

Her Story follows Hannah’s interrogation and is an interactive full-motion video (FMV) narrative made up of seven police interviews, split into smaller clips viewed on a 1990s-style desktop. Players watch, interpret and dissect these interviews to discover the truth in the characters’ stories.

Independently developed by Sam Barlow, Her Story uses live-action footage instead of rendered character models and is influenced by the directing techniques of Alfred Hitchcock and the Dogme 95 school of filmmaking, as well as real-life interrogations and Sharon Stone’s performance in Basic Instinct (1992).

results.title: Observation
results.brief_description: The space station Observation is twirling through the cosmos, the power cut and the crew missing. Players must help solve the mystery by taking control of SAM (Systems Administration Maintenance), the station’s AI software that’s based on HAL from Stanley Kubrick’s 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968).

constellations_primary.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_primary.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

results.description:
The space station Observation is twirling through the cosmos, the power cut and the crew missing. The station’s lone occupant is Dr Emma Fisher, who players must help solve the mystery by taking control of SAM (Systems Administration Maintenance), the station’s AI software that’s based on HAL from Stanley Kubrick’s 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968). This sci-fi thriller draws inspiration from many similar interstellar-set horror stories and puts players in command of a potentially malevolent AI.

The developers were intrigued by the question of whether AI could even be evil or if its code had somehow failed it. Observation players get to explore that idea, and their actions as SAM affect the game world and story.
description_for_label:
The space station Observation is twirling through the cosmos, the power cut and the crew missing. The station’s lone occupant is Dr Emma Fisher, who players must help solve the mystery by taking control of SAM (Systems Administration Maintenance), the station’s AI software that’s based on HAL from Stanley Kubrick’s 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968). This sci-fi thriller draws inspiration from many similar interstellar-set horror stories and puts players in command of a potentially malevolent AI.

The developers were intrigued by the question of whether AI could even be evil or if its code had somehow failed it. Observation players get to explore that idea, and their actions as SAM affect the game world and story.

results.title: The Gardens Between
results.brief_description: Following the relationship between two childhood friends, Ariana and Frendt, each level is full of objects that tease out shared memories and moments in time. Players don’t control the characters per se, but they instead use the game’s time-based mechanic to fast forwards or backwards.

constellations_primary.name: Time to rewind (The Gardens Between)
constellations_primary.description: This constellation explores media works that manipulate time, specifically by utitlising a reverse play structure to tell a story.

constellations_other.name: Perception, time and flickering images
constellations_other.description: Using a peep hole and a loop of rotating still images, mutoscopes control the point of view of the audience while also creating the illusion of depth. Filmmakers have since put optical tricks to work creating surreal scenes.

results.description:
The importance of childhood friendships is something that the Voxel Agents, developers of The Gardens Between, wanted to explore in their acclaimed puzzle game.

Following the relationship between two childhood friends, Ariana and Frendt, each level is full of objects that tease out shared memories and moments in time. Players don’t control the characters per se, but they instead use the game’s time-based mechanic to fast forwards or backwards.

Rewinding to the development of the game, that time mechanic was first explored here with us at ACMI during a game jam.
description_for_label:
The importance of childhood friendships is something that the Voxel Agents, developers of The Gardens Between, wanted to explore in their acclaimed puzzle game.

Following the relationship between two childhood friends, Ariana and Frendt, each level is full of objects that tease out shared memories and moments in time. Players don’t control the characters per se, but they instead use the game’s time-based mechanic to fast forwards or backwards.

Rewinding to the development of the game, that time mechanic was first explored here with us at ACMI during a game jam.

results.title: Portal 2
results.brief_description: Portal 2 is an award-winning first-person puzzle adventure game, set in a crumbling science facility known as Aperture Labs.

constellations_primary.name: Sci-fi, surrealism and strangeness
constellations_primary.description: Step through Portal 2 to explore the links between its sci-fi comedy and the world of film and TV.

results.description:
Portal 2 is an award-winning first-person puzzle adventure game, set in a crumbling science facility known as Aperture Labs. Its unique gameplay mechanic allows players to shoot portals of two different colours that are linked. A player can then traverse their environment through the interlinked portal to solve a variety of complex puzzles.

Not only does Portal 2 have distinct gameplay, it also features some genre-defining voice performances from Stephen Merchant (Jojo Rabbit, The Office) and JK Simmons (Spider-Man, Oz).

The villainous AI system GLaDOS (Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System), voiced by Ellen McLain, is also a highlight and is considered one of the greatest characters in videogames.
description_for_label:
Portal 2 is an award-winning first-person puzzle adventure game, set in a crumbling science facility known as Aperture Labs. Its unique gameplay mechanic allows players to shoot portals of two different colours that are linked. A player can then traverse their environment through the interlinked portal to solve a variety of complex puzzles.

Not only does Portal 2 have distinct gameplay, it also features some genre-defining voice performances from Stephen Merchant (Jojo Rabbit, The Office) and JK Simmons (Spider-Man, Oz).

The villainous AI system GLaDOS (Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System), voiced by Ellen McLain, is also a highlight and is considered one of the greatest characters in videogames.
